Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: the node automation was dev cause I had a job and no way to have a ssh during the day :p

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: I also wanted to share and have a way to monitor any node without any harm

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: just with a json sending

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: nothing else

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: cause at start we had to rely on different branchez and a way of tracking this without risk

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: is to just produce a standarfized json at regular interval

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: deposit this to a webserv and you got notarystats.com

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: I wznted it to be spread to all NN, but noone seemed to consider those infos crucial, or at least not enough

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: so deprecated lazynode and moved on

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: But the goal was also to refine the notary network

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: am sure with a basic script without any dependency we can produce a wellformed json

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: any op just need to push it to a designatef webserver and we have a real live monitoring

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: but in case of emergency... knowing who is on what branch is imo very important and we can make direct calls to operators and be more precise

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: instead of saying : please update

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: don t get cocky we ll get attacked and noone is awaken 24/7

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: so with a *yes I know it feels baaaad, but* centralized json... we basically can have live alerts on anything (I realize we re on general, sry)

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: we got the chance to operate in different timezones, this could help ^.^

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Also creating our own tor ... where you use notary nodes themselgf to ping packets a random number of times before arrivinga t destination, will not work as statistically over time, nodes close to each other will still group together.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The answer is to just slow down revcmask a bit but not too mcuh.. I still dont know how to do this though.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Go too far with it and the entire network just gets slower, and you will also reward crappy nodes with bad ops that dont know how tro run them with even counts.

Content: There is a fine line between a "crappy" node, and a node that doesnt work though

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: YEs that is the problem with slowing it down. It would be a hardforking change, so a testnet would be needed (liekly with 64 ndoes aswell) so not an easy task to tune it right.

-ac_end=20000 -ac_staked=100 & 

it's correct?
